results.title: Metformin and Rifampicin combination augments active to latent tuberculosis conversion: A computational study.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Rifampin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D012293 @@@Rifampicin@@@ combination augments active to @<m>DISEASE_Latent_Tuberculosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D055985 @@@latent tuberculosis@@@ conversion: A computational study.

citations.NLM: Yadav D, Kaur S, Banerjee D, Bhattacharyya R. Metformin and Rifampicin combination augments active to latent tuberculosis conversion: A computational study. Biotechnol Appl Biochem. 2021 Dec;68(6):1307-1312. PMID: 33059386

results.title: Reduced prevalence of latent tuberculosis infection in diabetes patients using metformin and statins.
results.text_hl: Reduced prevalence of @<m>DISEASE_Latent_Tuberculosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D055985 @@@latent tuberculosis infection@@@ in @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetes@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ using @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ and statins.

citations.NLM: Magee MJ, Salindri AD, Kornfeld H, Singhal A. Reduced prevalence of latent tuberculosis infection in diabetes patients using metformin and statins. Eur Respir J. 2019 Mar;53(3):. PMID: 30523163

results.title: Latent tuberculosis in patients with diabetes mellitus: prevalence, progression and public health implications.
results.text_hl: Multivariate analysis revealed that any co-morbidity (p=0.016) was positively associated while @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ (p=0.008) was negatively associated with @<m>DISEASE_Latent_Tuberculosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D055985 @@@LTBI@@@.

citations.NLM: Leow MK, Dalan R, Chee CB, Earnest A, Chew DE, Tan AW, Kon WY, Jong M, Barkham T, Wang YT. Latent tuberculosis in patients with diabetes mellitus: prevalence, progression and public health implications. Exp Clin Endocrinol Diabetes. 2014 Oct;122(9):528-32. PMID: 25003362
